config.question: What permanent solution was suggested by the Peace Commission created by Congress in 1867 to eliminate the causes of Indian wars?

choices.content: to create reservations for Native Americans, teaching them to farm and civilizing them
to banish Native Americans to the north of the United States and claim the western lands for whites from the East
to establish a separate Indian nation that would be out-of-bounds to all white people
to set up schools for the Native Americans and integrate them into mainstream American society

answer_3.response: Consider This: Westerners in general favored firm control over the Native Americans, including swift punishment of any who rebelled. Yet in 1867 it was the peace advocates who won the debate. Halting construction on the Bozeman Trail, Congress created a Peace Commission. See L.O. 17.2 How did white Americans crush the culture of the Native Americans as they moved west?
